The Fe 2+-Mg ordering state was obtained from the site populations in order to calculate the closure temperature by means of the intracrystalline distribution coefficient ( k D), using the expression

k D = [(Fe 2+ M1) (Mg M2)/(Fe 2+ M2)(Mg M1)]. The relationship between the distribution coefficient ( k D) and T C is usually expressed using calibration equations of the lnk D as a function of 1/ T(K).
